data.title: Add checking invaild project name
data.body:
Can't create folder with `\ / : * ? " < > |` characters on Windows.
fixes #4928

data.title: Translation snap with local coordinates activated behaves incorrect
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Tested in Arch Linux with Godot version 2.0.3 stable and git master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Translation snap with local coordinates activated behaves incorrect.
![2016-06-02_09-12-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9007314/15736848/d6d8369e-28a2-11e6-8b46-cece4ceea92b.gif)

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Rotate an object to an arbitrary rotation
- Activate translation snap, for example 5
- Activate local coordinates
- Move the object

Godot 2.0.3 stable

data.title: Tileset scaling: big tiles make it unusable
data.body:
The preview of the tileset in the tilemap editor was recently improved by @Hinsbart and @bojidar-bg, to make it possible to zoom in and out, which is great.

If you test [this level of Jetpaca](https://github.com/KOBUGE-Games/jetpaca/blob/master/stages/world_1/forest_fun.tscn) though, you will see that it can become very unwieldy if there is a tile that is disproportioned compared to the others:

![spectacle g10877](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/15736141/ebec144c-289d-11e6-9e04-b032a7846024.png)

I think the tileset preview should use its width as a limiting factor for each tile's scaling. When iterating over all tiles to set their dimensions corresponding to the current zoom factor, if the calculated dimensions are wider than the panel width, we should set the preview of this tile to a custom zoom factor corresponding to the panel width. Other smaller tiles should still be able to be scaled up and down independently of this limiting tile (if possible, even allowing to keep this big tile on a single column even when the smaller tiles start being stacked on several columns at low zoom factors).

data.title: Remove Make-related flags from Android build
data.body:
They were wrongly placed, creating a file named "-fpic" instead of
applying "-fpic" to the build. This file was in .gitignore, which made it
less noticiable.

This also adds build.gradle to .gitignore.

data.title: MaterialShaderGraph deleting node randomly selects another node
data.body:
**OSX 10.11.4 iMac early 2008 - Godot version:2.0.3**

**Issue on MaterialShaderGraph deleting node:**
I have some nodes in the Graph view, if i delete one node, a random node is selected and if i move the mouse the new selected node moves with the mouse. Sometimes more than one node is randomly selected and is moving with the mouse and overlapping each other.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just create some nodes and delete one of them and than move the mouse.

data.title: Add optional snap & global/local coordinates controls in the 3D editor toolbar/viewport
data.body:
- button to toggle between global and local coordinates
- buttons to enable/disable translation, rotation, scaling snap
- menus to quickly set common snap values
- remove "Use Snap" in Transform menu, and add check button for snap translation, rotation, scaling
- added simple validation of snap configuration window values
- added icons for the new buttons that look different from the tool buttons, to not confuse users
- added sub-menu in Translate menu to show/hide the toolbar controls + choose which side the controls should be shown (so the user can set according to preference)
- state for snap buttons/values are saved/restored in the scene
- state for the transform toolbar control visibility and position (left/right/viewport) is saved in the editor preferences
- default behavior is that the controls are visible and shown to the left with the other menu controls.

3D viewport transform toolbar controls - controls demo video: https://youtu.be/pTm1JnmgFEU
3D viewport transform toolbar controls - Left/right + show/hide demo video: https://youtu.be/mLHFWdGR840

Related issue: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4850

Please review and let me know the things that need to be corrected or changed. I'm sure there are things I didn't think about since this is the first time I looked into the source code.

The scale and global/local coordinate icons are open source and without attribution. The grid and rotation icons are made by me and can be used without attribution.

data.title: Removed invalid DEFVAL for HTTPClient::request_raw
data.body: That method has no default value.

data.title: Error in console, can't add individual class items while editing themes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- Arch Linux
- Godot 2.1 Git (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/4192d6d5512611825c777aea7af0c8a9478ee290)
- Clang 3.8.0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Trying to add an _individual_ item class for theming projects will result in this error:

```
ERROR: set_stylebox: Condition ' p_style.is_null() ' is true.
    At: scene/resources/theme.cpp:320.
```

Adding all class items for a given GUI Control type will work fine.

data.title: Expose extra methods and constants to scripts
data.body: Simply exposes a bunch of methods and constants to scripting engine. It's most specifically aimed at giving the elements necessary to implement GUI elements via scripting, primarily where there is the ability lacking to correct assign and detect theme elements and overrides. One change is that it splits the has_\* methods into having seperate has_*_override methods and will also fix an issue with detect passing empty strings as a prompt to search for potential overrides.

data.title: Sort translations
data.body: Implements #4947 , sorts translations while building. English is however at the top, since it's not handled as other translations, sorting it also would non-trivial. However I think this behavior is fine, since English is handled this way in many applications.

data.title: Uncropped Viewport node in 2D editor overlaps editor UI
data.body:
Godot v. 2.0.3 stable, Win x64

**What happened:**
In a simple setup like the one the figure shows (2D: `Control` -> `Viewport` -> Instanced 3D `Scene`) the root `Control` (and thus the `Viewport`) can be dragged as to overlap some of the editor UI elements.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11797174/15709212/ccc8c488-2803-11e6-9035-653816135175.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a scene like the one in the figure or the attached files and drag the root `Control` outside the visible area.

**Link to minimal example project**
[A sample project which shows the bug.](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-WnZEtQk02PSlFzQnAzdTlyNXM/view?usp=sharing)

_By the way, GitHub has rejected to upload the same .zip file to this post. I think it would be better to embed the test project than linking to it. Strange enough, it tells me to "Try agagin with a PNG, GIF, [..], or ZIP." (!)_

data.title: Can't Launch on Windows 7
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Windows 7 x64 - Godot 2.1 alpha phase at commit df139f5 or newer

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Godot Engine can't Launch on Windows 7.

![w7 - godot issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10663548/15707368/30be8b7e-281a-11e6-8be7-a2b1f51395e0.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Compile Godot for Windows, from Source (commit df139f5 or newer) using MSVC12 (VS2013) or MSVC14 (VS2015). I didn't test it using Mingw nor Cross Compiling from Linux OS.
2) Launch Godot on Windows 7.
3) Can't Launch.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
- None

data.title: Several errors in german translation
data.body:
**Godot version:**
commit 1ae9ff19194af9a365b3a76e50ee8d3aa01205b8

The commit da25b76aa1c1950df34d540e808919f2f3740b9d added a lot of good translations but also has also some errors as listed below:

```
 #: tools/editor/code_editor.cpp
 msgid "Match Case"
-msgstr ""
+msgstr "bereinstimmung"
```

Should be translated as `"Gro-/Kleinschreibung bercksichtigen"`

```
#: tools/editor/code_editor.cpp tools/editor/script_editor_debugger.cpp
 msgid "Line:"
-msgstr ""
+msgstr "Zeile"
```

The punctuation is missing, should be `"Zeile:"`

```
#: tools/editor/project_export.cpp
 msgid "Error exporting project!"
-msgstr ""
+msgstr "Fehler beim exportieren des Projekts!"
```

Should be translated as: `"Fehler beim Exportieren des Projekts!"`

```
#: tools/editor/project_settings.cpp
 msgid "Press a Key.."
-msgstr ""
+msgstr "Drck eine Taste"
```

Should be translated as `"Drcke eine Taste.."`

The placeholder option doesn't work on a instance of a .tscn scene. But an instance of this same scene saved as .scn works as a placeholder.

data.title: Error while compiling for windows universal: 'OSWinrt': cannot instantiate abstract class
data.body:
I am running Windows 8.1 64-bit with 32-bit Python 2.7.11 and 32-bit pywin32 build 220 and scons 2.5.0 with Godot source cloned from the branch 'master'. When running (using a Visual Studio 2015 x64 Native Tools Command Prompt): 
scons platform=winrt
from the source directory it will run for a few seconds then give this error: 
platform\winrt\app.cpp(71): error C2259: 'OSWinrt': cannot instantiate abstract class
platform\winrt\app.cpp(71): note: due to following members:
platform\winrt\app.cpp(71): note: 'Size2 OS::get_window_size(void) const': is abstract
C:\godot\core\os/os.h(167): note: see declaration of 'OS::get_window_size'
platform\winrt\app.cpp(114): warning C4291: 'void *operator new(size_t,const char *)': no matching operator delete found; memory will not be freed if initialization throws an exception
c:\godot\core\os/memory.h(207): note: see declaration of 'operator new'
scons: *** [platform\winrt\app.winrt.tools.x64.obj] Error 2
scons: building terminated because of errors.

Fixes #4915

data.title: Collision detection at startup issue
data.body:
I am really hesitant to report this, but I ran out of options.

The issue is that at running the project, when Godot logo with splash screen appears, the nodes `_fixed_process()` function starts. All fine and dandy, but the problem is at the same time collisions doesn't work if there is one at startup! I used manual collision checking for RayCast2D or even Area2D, they fail to report collisions or overlapped areas when there is already one at startup. The collision objects ends up half way through the ground.

I suspected that physics server is not yet loaded and running when the nodes are already moving. What I did and seems to fix it:

```
onready var testTime = 0

func _read():
    set_fixed_process(true)

func _fixed_process(delta):
    testTime += delta
    if (testTime < 1):
        return

 ... rest of processing, collision checking .. etc!..
```

Is this the proper way of fixing it? Why `_ready()` is called when in fact it is not ready?

data.body: Ported the Area2D documentation into its 3D counterpart. Also fixed some typos
